intro: Rhagodia spinescens, commonly known as the spiny hakea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its woody shrub form with spiny stems and narrow, leathery leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing features such as reduced leaf surface to minimize water loss. Rhagodia spinescens is often found in rocky soils and is an important component of native vegetation in its habitat.
